p: The enantioselective analysis was performed using 2,3-diethyl-6-tert-butyldimethylsilyl-β-cyclodextrin as a chiral selector [ 16, 17]. Sabinene, phellandrene, linalool, and α-terpineol enantiomeric pairs were identified. The respective enantiomeric distribution and enantiomeric excess (e.e.) is presented in Table 2. In Piper carpunya EO, (1 R, 5 R)-(+)-Sabinene is the enantiomer with the highest enantiomeric distribution (93.3%) and an enantiomeric excess of 86.5%. The enantiomeric composition of essential oil can be used as a powerful tool for detecting adulterations [ 18]. These results further confirm that chiral secondary metabolites are often present in plants as enantiomeric mixtures.
